jurisdiction.title: Roman Catholic Diocese of Joliet Illinois

ECAD9DEF637E4996A616152DED449C0A.description: Share their response to Bible Stories or Sunday readings as an integral part of their lifelong faith formation.

Share Scripture Stories as a group through drama, art,

Homily.

of Scripture.

3D4684C62D8549AAA914527676D4B86F.description: Know that we can read the Bible together and talk about it.

0A083617E90647029406E47420409E52.description: Recognize and engage in personal and communal Catholic forms of prayer, of Scripture study, and of other experiences that deepen one’s spiritual life.

907D156FFFB2499D93946A54CB93B92B.description: Understand how to read Scripture and to integrate Scripture into personal prayer-Life Application

Be aware that they hear readings from the Bible at Mass

34991F5356A549109484B9B1D552D647.description: Recognize and engage in personal and communal Catholic forms of prayer, of scripture study, and of other experiences that deepen one’s spiritual life.

music, technology, etc.

4B697E05A277461E9998C2F35190CDD2.description:

53FD85E223524CF8A8BBDB9757458E67.description:

1CBE0FF383354C018A892623C3EE68BD.description:

from Jesus.

D90DA227E3964A358113798479B72FC9.description:

DB5F3DA55F9F464D9E9D6E0A5F7CE170.description: Understand that we can pray alone or together.

9876CC458B784C208F2032FD006728F5.description:
Pray with family. (“Christian family is first place for
education and prayer”. CCC #2694)

BCBDE13E31154DBC91EC0B7038369527.description: Make prayer a part of their daily life.

330E6BE870DB4AE19B213CEF94D8326B.description: Understand and accept the call to enter into a personal relationship with God-Life Application

music, technology, etc.

84DF05E1A15B448F9A3962EDFB554ECF.description: Practice ways to enter into prayer.

75319B00FB3447D9B5B88B077BC0EEB9.description: Know they can pray to God as their best friend and their loving parent.

9CF115CBC13C47B3B8FBC9C311439DCA.description: Know various ways to pray, for example song meditation, quiet prayer.

BB32E254F90E4BE5AF121A0876AFCB6B.description:

21AEB4A87E744FEFA9254E07D667BF32.description:
Know that prayer is talking to and listening to God
(Jesus).

C85BAF9DBF464CFF8DB15DDF37DD6DB8.description: Understand and accept the call to enter into a personal relationship with God-Knowledge

9F6A8F510BDE42628526432919BF5C5E.description: Recognize and engage in personal and communal Catholic forms of prayer, of scripture study, and of other experiences that deepen one’s spiritual life.

789C025157F046D18CACD2712E0FEF9C.description: Demonstrate a Christian model of living.

1ABEC474F6D5418181305A282B7EFA4F.description: Relate stories about God to others.

Illustrate stewardship and evangelization through drama,
art, music, technology, etc.

5FDB52A3F0EC4019A86616777F3D5414.description:
Participate in experiences of environmental stewardship,
e.g. recycling, ecological projects, etc.

559E1F7BDDB24AF7BA65423243A0F698.description:
Respect property and environment at school, at home, in
the parish and in the community.

DDC40E120BBE404186C5B714198D42F5.description:
Describe how we can take care of God’s World, e.g.
people, animals, nature, etc.

86553854B29144A2BF19864CC7F3C037.description: Know that we are witnesses to the Gospel as responsible members of the local and of the universal Catholic Church, stewards of the world, and evangelizers for Christ-Skill

07281571D85F4D78878115FAC12DF81E.description:
Know that we are called to share the Good News of Jesus
with other people.

29E2B6251E5245CEBFB547AB23CD8619.description: Know that God asks us to take care of the world.

B6809407F14F45DC9E2646F0A279DFD1.description:

Work.

43B670C15BA44612BEB4A7AFD1A6A2A5.description:

8A1FAAF7269340609329F45D4502CA74.description: Know that God’s presence helps us through difficult times.

2EB5739F7AC144E8B7A8E8A8F4D3D3BF.description: Goal 3-Understand and appreciate that through Baptism we are called to life in Christ.

accepting others.

you.

CE8D44CF48A84F92A9550C81EBC61A2F.description: Understand the need to help others.

self.

Illustrate how God wants us to live using drama, art,
music, technology, etc.

Reflect on how to be a better follower of Jesus

C776519251304B3F82D42CA13949054F.description: Show their love for God by helping others.

0E6B03A3DA93447BA5B45D97CB2C9B2B.description: Understand the importance of the Beatitudes and of the Commandments as a means to the development of a well-formed conscience-Skill

Understand that they have free will and that they are

AD9A39BA3D2D4FD4B96D3AE53271E435.description: . Understand the meaning of the “Golden Rule”.

5C69712AE6FB43AE9FD11DC25D0C8433.description:
Understand the love of God, the love of neighbor and

48A5EE6534AB4EA0A4F01CDED4D4EDB3.description:

84E0B4DD505C46FA80FEF646982BF507.description: Know that the Mass is prayer.

Spread the Gospel message by living like Jesus by

. Illustrate the origin, Tradition and mission of the Church

Be familiar with particular stories, parables and miracles of
Jesus; for example they need to recognize the concepts of
the Prodigal Son, Good Samaritan, Zaccheus, Lost Sheep,
loaves and fishes, healing of the man born blind, Last
Supper, Raising of Lazarus, etc.

AB339CEDBE6249119A495A9C44AA7CF8.description:
Be familiar with the story of the Death and of the
Resurrection of Jesus.

9D884B9B7C914767A55ABA8C6E814F59.description:
Know the stories of the Annunciation and of the birth of
Jesus.

7D56C72DF4664A1DA8B56CD6A60D3760.description: Know that the life of Jesus is found in the Bible.

05E6255D59CB4C36BB303C14FF3931D7.description:
Know that the Bible has two parts (Old and New
Testaments).

6D1E879064E34CDAB24F2CFDB4CCED6F.description: Standard B: Understand the life of Jesus as revealed through Sacred Scripture-Knowledge

73C2F88D4FFE49F3906D64F3A65FF89D.description: Goal 1-Know and understand the basic teachings of the Catholic Church

B6D117E9BCAB4D58AD819495D260ACFC.description:
Share with family their understanding of God: Father, Son
and Holy Spirit.

6FDDCEE1448A4EB8A914EE49F4AD11AE.description:
Attend Mass with family and pray the Nicene Creed along
with assembly.

0E2C7099FFD6427DB827EB046B57EC08.description: Standard A: Recognize that the Creed reveals the fundamental teachings of the Catholic Church-Life Application

18EEA75B81C343CE80798A11B4CA7342.description:
Illustrate the three persons of the Trinity using drama, art,
music, technology, etc.

Name the three persons of the Trinity and relate it to the
Sign of the Cross

6F6E33101DB64BE799962D4801454D6D.description: Recite and make the Sign of the Cross

CA545A55AA1A496BB44A9A1AE46CF9BB.description: Standard A: Recognize that the Creed reveals the fundamental teachings of the Catholic Church-Skill

4B8130F74AB145769482AA5FB1F1FEDD.description: Understand that Jesus died to give us new life.

BE92AC5A920746DE9F397993FA4ABA8B.description: Recognize that the Creed is a statement of our faith.

49265D4ACD874CDB91D20575407DF664.description: Know that we belong to God’s family, the Church.

C081CE6624454F6B962D27B5BC0B0C7E.description:
Recognize the beauty of God’s love through all that
He made.

9A991211C04449F29A97A9858405A6E0.description: Know that God’s very being is truth and love.

B1FB45F7988E478E86A38569EAD9F4C7.description:
Recognize God (Father, Son and Holy Spirit) is Creator of
all things (CCC 316).

FF981FC8C2CE4B4891C555FC63095EF6.description:
Know the three persons in one God:
a. Name God as Father.
b. Name Jesus as God’s Son.
c. Name the Holy Spirit as our helper
